update.description:
This pull request makes it possible to set the sonar collision shape.

It also writes the closest contact position in sonar message to display a red ray going from the reference point to the closest contact point.
update.title: Sonar sensors with a spherical collision shape

content.raw: Can you restructure this code to prevent a `throw`? Instead, you can default to `cone` and output an error if `geometry` is invalid.
content.html: Can you restructure this code to prevent a throw? Instead, you can default to cone and output an error if geometry is invalid.

pull_request.title: Sonar sensors with a spherical collision shape

pullrequest.title: Sonar sensors with a spherical collision shape

content.html:
Can you check for "sphere" or "cone" string values here? Something like:

std::string geom = dPtr->sonarMsg->sonar().geometry(); 
if (geom != "sphere" && geom != "cone")
   geom = "cone";

dPtr->shapeVis->InsertMesh("unit_" + geom);
dPtr->shapeVis->AttachMesh("unit_" + geom);

content.raw: It seems that the two possible values at the moment are `cone` and `sphere`. How about calling this field `geometry` instead? The first time I saw it, I thought it would be a mesh's URI. We've also been trying to document messages, mind adding a description which mentions the supported values?
content.html: It seems that the two possible values at the moment are cone and sphere. How about calling this field geometry instead? The first time I saw it, I thought it would be a mesh's URI. We've also been trying to document messages, mind adding a description which mentions the supported values?
